translation: Shuo wuglishheng jing, vol. 5

source_sentence: 大唐三藏法師玄奘譯
translation: Translated by the Tripiṭaka Master Xuanzang of the Great Tang

source_sentence: 香臺佛品第十
translation: 10. The Tenth Chapter of the Buddha of the Fragrant Terrace

source_sentence: 時舍利子作是思惟：「食時將至，此摩訶薩說法未起，我等聲聞及諸菩薩當於何食？」
translation: Śāriputra then had this thought, When the time comes for food, where will we śrāvakas and bodhisattvas eat when this Mahāsattva's teaching doesn't arise?

source_sentence: 時無垢稱知彼思惟便告之曰：「大德！
translation: Knowing what they thought, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti told them, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如來為諸聲聞說八解脫，仁者已住，勿以財食染污其心而聞正法。
translation: The Tathāgata teaches the eight liberations for śrāvakas, so don't let their minds be stained by wealth or food and hear the right teaching.

source_sentence: 若欲食者且待須臾，當令皆得未曾有食。」
translation: Those who want to eat it will wait for a moment, and they'll all attain unprecedented food.

source_sentence: 時無垢稱便入如是微妙寂定，發起如是殊勝神通，示諸菩薩、大聲聞眾，
translation: At that moment, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti entered such a subtle and tranquil concentration. Having developed such extraordinary superknowledges, he showed them to the bodhisattvas and great disciples:

source_sentence: 上方界分去此佛土過四十二殑伽沙等諸佛世界，有佛世界名一切妙香，
translation: In the upper realm there is a buddha-world called All Wonderful Fragrances, beyond as many buddha-lands as there are sands in forty-two Ganges rivers.

source_sentence: 其中有佛號最上香臺，今現在彼安隱住持。
translation: Among them, there's a Buddha named the supreme fragrant dais of incense that's now peacefully abiding there.

source_sentence: 彼世界中有妙香氣，比餘十方一切佛土人天之香最為第一。
translation: In that world, there's a wonderful fragrance that's the most superior to the fragrance of humans and gods in all the other buddha lands in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 彼有諸樹皆出妙香，普薰方域一切周滿。
translation: There are trees there that all produce a wonderful fragrance that permeates all the directions and fills everything.

source_sentence: 彼中無有二乘之名，唯有清淨大菩薩眾，而彼如來為其說法。
translation: They don't have the names of the two vehicles, but only pure great bodhisattvas, and the Tathāgata explains the teaching for them.

source_sentence: 彼世界中一切臺觀、宮殿、經行、園林、衣服皆是種種妙香所成。
translation: In those worlds, all the terraces, halls, walks, parks, and clothing are made of various kinds of exquisite fragrance.

source_sentence: 彼佛世尊及菩薩眾所食香氣微妙第一，普薰十方無量佛土。
translation: The fragrance of the food eaten by those buddhas, world-honored ones and bodhisattvas is subtle and most subtle, pervading measureless Buddha lands in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 時彼如來與諸菩薩方共坐食，彼有天子名曰香嚴——已於大乘深心發趣——供養承事彼土如來及諸菩薩。
translation: When the Tathāgata and the bodhisattvas were sitting together to eat, there was a celestial being named Gandhamādana-who had deeply arisen the aspiration for the great vehicle and had offered support to the Tathāgatas and bodhisattvas of that land.

source_sentence: 時此大眾一切皆覩彼界如來與諸菩薩方共坐食如是等事。
translation: All of these people then saw that the Tathāgata and the bodhisattvas in the other realm were sitting together, eating and so forth.

source_sentence: 時無垢稱遍告一切菩薩眾言：「汝等大士誰能往彼取妙香食？」
translation: The Licchavi Vimalakīrti then addressed all the bodhisattvas, saying, Who of you great men will go there to get a wonderfully fragrant food?

source_sentence: 以妙吉祥威神力故，諸菩薩眾咸皆默然。
translation: Because of the authoritative power of Mañjuśrī, all the bodhisattvas were silent.

source_sentence: 時無垢稱告妙吉祥：「汝今云何於此大眾而不加護，令其乃爾？」
translation: The Licchavi Vimalakīrti then addressed Mañjuśrī, Now, why don't you protect this crowd of people and cause them to do so?

source_sentence: 妙吉祥言：「居士！
translation: Miaojixiang said, Guru!

source_sentence: 汝今不應輕毀諸菩薩眾，如佛所言：『勿輕未學。』」
translation: Now, you shouldn't despise the bodhisattvas, just as the Buddha said, 'Don't despise those who haven't studied.'

source_sentence: 時無垢稱不起于床，居眾會前化作菩薩——身真金色，相好莊嚴，威德光明蔽於眾會——而告之曰：「汝善男子！
translation: The Licchavi Vimalakīrti didn't rise from his seat, stayed in front of the congregation, and transformed himself into a bodhisattva whose body was truly golden-colored, adorned with characteristics and features, and whose authoritative radiance covered the congregation—and told him, Good man!

source_sentence: 宜往上方去此佛土過四十二殑伽沙等諸佛世界，有佛世界名一切妙香，
translation: “Furthermore, reverend Śāriputra, go upward beyond as many buddha-fields as there are sands in forty-two Ganges rivers to this buddha-field. There is a buddha-field called All Wonderful Fragrances

source_sentence: 其中有佛號最上香臺，與諸菩薩方共坐食。
translation: Among them, there's a Buddha named Supreme Fragrant Terrace with the names of the buddhas and bodhisattvas who are sitting together to eat.

source_sentence: 汝往到彼頂禮佛足，應作是言：『於此下方有無垢稱，稽首雙足，敬問世尊：「少病、少惱、起居輕利、氣力康和、安樂住不？」
translation: Going there, you should bow your head at the Buddha's feet and say, 'There's an unsullied name below here that bows its head at his feet and respectfully asks the Bhagavān, Is it possible to live with little illness, little affliction, little agitation, little lift, little energy, and peace and comfort?'

source_sentence: 遙心右繞多百千匝，頂禮雙足作如是言：「願得世尊所食之餘，當於下方堪忍世界施作佛事，
translation: He circled to his right from a great distance many hundreds of thousands of times, bowed his head and feet at their feet, and said these words:

source_sentence: 令此下劣欲樂有情當欣大慧，亦使如來無量功德名稱普聞。」』」
translation: That will cause these inferior sentient beings who want to delight in pleasure to rejoice in great wisdom, and it will also cause the Tathāgata's name of immeasurable merit to be universally heard.'

source_sentence: 時化菩薩於眾會前上昇虛空——舉眾皆見——神通迅疾經須臾頃便到一切妙香世界，
translation: The apparitional bodhisattva then rose up into the sky in front of the assembly and said to the congregation, “O goddess, please show me how quickly you can reach this universe called Sarvagandhasugandhā.

source_sentence: 頂禮最上香臺佛足，又聞其言：「下方菩薩名無垢稱，稽首雙足，敬問世尊：『少病、少惱、起居輕利、氣力康和、安樂住不？』
translation: He bowed his head at the feet of the Buddha on the supreme fragrant dais and heard him say, Down below, the bodhisattva named Vimalakīrti Bodhisattva bowed his head at both feet and respectfully asked the Bhagavān, 'Is there little illness, little affliction, little agitation, lightness in rising and standing, well-balance

source_sentence: 遙心右繞多百千匝，頂禮雙足作如是言：『願得世尊所食之餘，當於下方堪忍世界施作佛事，
translation: He circled to his right from a great distance many hundreds of thousands of times, bowed his head and feet at their feet, and said these words:

source_sentence: 令此下劣欲樂有情當欣大慧，亦使如來無量功德名稱普聞。』」
translation: That will cause these inferior sentient beings with desire and pleasure to delight in great wisdom, and that will also cause the Tathāgata's name of immeasurable merit to be universally heard.'

source_sentence: 時彼上方菩薩眾會見化菩薩相好莊嚴，威德光明微妙殊勝，歎未曾有：「今此大士從何處來？
translation: When the bodhisattvas up there saw the transformation bodhisattva's appearance and beauty adorned, his authoritative radiance and subtlety were marvelously superior, and they praised it as unprecedented, Where did this great man come from?

source_sentence: 堪忍世界為在何所？
translation: Where is the world of forbearance?

source_sentence: 云何名為下劣欲樂？」
translation: What's called inferior desire and pleasure?

source_sentence: 尋問最上香臺如來：「唯願世尊為說斯事。」
translation: He asked the supreme fragrant dais Tathāgata, Please, Bhagavān, explain this matter for him.

source_sentence: 佛告之曰：「諸善男子！
translation: The Buddha told them, Good men!

source_sentence: 於彼下方去此佛土過四十二殑伽沙等諸佛世界，有佛世界名曰堪忍，其中佛號釋迦牟尼如來、應、正等覺，
translation: “Beyond this buddha-land, beyond as many buddha-fields as there are sands in forty-two Ganges rivers, is a buddha-world called Forbearance, where the Buddha Śākyamuni Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One lives.

source_sentence: 今現在彼安隱住持，居五濁世為諸下劣欲樂有情宣揚正法。
translation: Now, he's a peaceful abiding maintainer who lives in the five turbid worlds and proclaims the right teaching for the sake of inferior sentient beings with desire.

source_sentence: 彼有菩薩名無垢稱——已得安住不可思議解脫法門——為諸菩薩開示妙法，
translation: There was a bodhisattva there called Vimalakīrti-who had settled into the teaching of inconceivable liberation and taught the wonderful Dharma to all bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 遣化菩薩來至此間稱揚我身功德名號，并讚此土眾德莊嚴，令彼菩薩善根增進。」
translation: They send transformation bodhisattvas here to praise the merits of my body and names, and they praise the adornment of the virtues of this land so that those bodhisattvas' good roots will increase.

source_sentence: 彼菩薩眾咸作是言：「其德何如乃作是化，大神通力無畏若斯？」
translation: The bodhisattvas all said, What's the virtue of this transformation that it does, and what's the great fearlessness of supernormal powers that it does?

source_sentence: 彼佛告言：「諸善男子！
translation: The Buddha told them, Good men!

source_sentence: 是大菩薩成就殊勝大功德法，一剎那頃化作無量無邊菩薩，遍於十方一切國土，
translation: In an instant, this great enlightening being accomplished the supreme teaching of great virtue, and in an instant he emanated infinitely many boundless bodhisattvas pervading all lands in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 皆遣其往施作佛事，利益安樂無量有情。」
translation: They all send them away to perform buddha-works for the benefit and welfare of measureless sentient beings.

source_sentence: 於是，最上香臺如來以能流出眾妙香器盛諸妙香所薰之食，授無垢稱化菩薩手。
translation: Then, the supremely fragrant dais of buddhahood, the Tathāgata with a vessel capable of producing all kinds of exquisite fragrances and filling it with food perfumed by those fragrances, gave the hands of the Bodhisattva Immaculate Teaching to him.

source_sentence: 時彼佛土有九百萬大菩薩僧同時舉聲請於彼佛：「我等欲與此化菩薩俱往下方堪忍世界，
translation: In that buddha-land, nine million great bodhisattvas and monks simultaneously raised their voices to the Buddha and said to him, “We wish to go down with these apparitional bodhisattvas to the world patience.

source_sentence: 瞻仰釋迦牟尼如來，禮敬供事、聽聞正法，并欲瞻仰、禮敬供事彼無垢稱及諸菩薩，
translation: “Great enlightening beings also pay their respects to the Tathāgata Śākyamuni and venerate, serve, and listen to him. They also wish to venerate, serve, and pay their respects to that Immaculate Teaching and other enlightening beings.

source_sentence: 唯願世尊加護聽許。」
translation: Please, Bhagavān, please protect and allow me to hear it.

source_sentence: 彼佛告曰：「諸善男子！
translation: The Buddha told them, Good men!

source_sentence: 汝便可往，今正是時。
translation: Now is the right time for you to go.

source_sentence: 汝等皆應自攝身香入堪忍界，勿令彼諸有情醉悶放逸；
translation: All of you should collect your own bodily odor and enter the realm of tolerance. Do not let those sentient beings become intoxicated or indulge in idleness.

source_sentence: 汝等皆應自隱色相入堪忍界，勿令彼諸菩薩心生愧恥。
translation: You should all enter the tolerance realm by your own concealment of form and characteristics, so as not to cause those bodhisattvas to become ashamed.

source_sentence: 汝等於彼堪忍世界勿生劣想而作障礙。
translation: Don't give rise to inferior thoughts and create obstacles in that world of forbearance.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸善男子！
translation: “O sons of the virtuous!

source_sentence: 一切國土皆如虛空，諸佛、世尊為欲成熟諸有情故，隨諸有情所樂示現種種佛土——或染、或淨，
translation: All lands are like space. The buddhas and world-honored ones, wishing to develop sentient beings, show various buddha-lands according to the inclinations of sentient beings, either defiled or pure.

source_sentence: 無決定相——而諸佛土實皆清淨、無有差別。」
translation: There are no definite characteristics - but the buddha lands are really pure and have no distinctions.

source_sentence: 時化菩薩受滿食器，與九百萬諸菩薩僧，承彼佛威神及無垢稱力於彼界沒，
translation: The apparitional bodhisattva then accepted the full food vessel and went down in that realm with 9 million bodhisattvas and monks, supported by the Buddha's authoritative power and unsullied praiseworthy power.

source_sentence: 經須臾頃至於此土無垢稱室欻然而現。
translation: In a moment's time, he arrived in this land and the unsullied chamber of praise suddenly appeared.

source_sentence: 時無垢稱化九百萬師子之座——微妙莊嚴，與前所坐諸師子座都無有異——令諸菩薩皆坐其上。
translation: The Licchavi Vimalakīrti then transformed nine million lion seats - subtly adorned, no different from the lion seats where they had previously sat - and caused all the bodhisattvas to sit on them.

source_sentence: 時化菩薩以滿食器授無垢稱。
translation: The transformation bodhisattva then filled the food container and gave it the undefiled name.

source_sentence: 如是食器妙香普薰廣嚴大城及此三千大千世界無量無邊。
translation: Thus, this food container of marvelous fragrance universally perfumes the vast and beautiful great city and these 3,000 great one-thousand worlds are immeasurable and limitless.

source_sentence: 妙香薰故，一切世界香氣芬馥。
translation: Because it's perfumed with a wonderful fragrance, the fragrance of all worlds is fragrant.

source_sentence: 廣嚴大城諸婆羅門、長者、居士、人、非人等，聞是香氣得未曾有，驚歎無量，
translation: The brahmans, wealthy merchants, householders, and non-humans in the great city of Vaiśālī heard this fragrance unprecedentedly. They marveled immeasurably when they smelled it.

source_sentence: 身心踊悅。
translation: Their bodies and minds are overjoyed.

source_sentence: 時此城中離呫毘王名為月蓋，與八萬四千離呫毘種，種種莊嚴，悉來入于無垢稱室，
translation: At that time the Licchavi king of that city, named Candracchattra (“Moon Canopy”), together with eighty-four thousand Licchavis, all adorned in various ways, came and entered the chamber called Vimalakīrti.

source_sentence: 見此室中諸菩薩眾其數甚多、諸師子座高廣嚴飾，生大歡喜，歎未曾有，
translation: Seeing the great congregation of enlightening beings in this house, many in number, with lion-thrones high and wide and beautifully arrayed, they were overjoyed and marveled at such an unprecedented sight.

source_sentence: 禮諸菩薩及大聲聞，却住一面。
translation: He bowed to the bodhisattvas and great śrāvakas and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 時諸地神及虛空神，并欲色界諸天子眾，聞是妙香，各與眷屬無量百千，
translation: When the earth goddesses, the space goddesses, and the celestial beings in the realm of desire and form heard this wonderful fragrance, they each gave it to an immeasurable number of hundreds of thousands of their retinues.

source_sentence: 悉來入于無垢稱室。
translation: They all came and entered the room that's called the undefiled abode.

source_sentence: 時無垢稱便語尊者舍利子等諸大聲聞：「尊者可食如來所施甘露味食。
translation: The Licchavi Vimalakīrti then said to Venerable Śāriputra and the other great śrāvakas, Venerable, you may eat the tasteful ambrosia food given by the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 如是食者，大悲所薰，勿以少分下劣心行而食此食；
translation: Those who eat in this way are imbued with great compassion. They should not eat such food because they act with a small part of their minds to be inferior.

source_sentence: 若如是食，定不能消。」
translation: If he eats like this, he won't surely be able to digest it.

source_sentence: 時眾會中有劣聲聞作如是念：「此食甚少，云何充足如是大眾？」
translation: At the time, there were some inferior śrāvakas in the assembly who had this thought, How could such a large crowd be satisfied with such a small amount of food?

source_sentence: 時化菩薩便告之言：「勿以汝等自少福慧測量如來無量福慧。
translation: The transformation bodhisattva then told them, Don't measure the Tathāgata's immeasurable merit and wisdom by your own lack of merit and wisdom.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 四大海水乍可有竭，是妙香食終無有盡。
translation: The four great waters of the ocean may sometimes dry up, but this subtle fragrant food never runs out.

source_sentence: 假使無量大千世界一切有情一一摶食，其食摶量等妙高山，如是摶食或經一劫、或一百劫猶不能盡。
translation: Suppose all the sentient beings in an infinite number of great one-thousand worlds were to eat a single mouthful of food, and it eats as many mouthfuls as there are marvelous high mountains, and this kind of food would still be inexhaustible even for an eon or a hundred eons.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如是食者，是無盡戒、定、慧、解脫、解脫知見所生。
translation: Such food is produced by inexhaustible morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge and vision of liberation.

source_sentence: 如來所食之餘，無量三千大千世界一切有情，經百千劫食此香食終不能盡，
translation: For hundreds of thousands of eons all the sentient beings in the great manifold cosmos ate this fragrant food, but they could not finish eating it.

source_sentence: 於是大眾皆食此食悉得充滿而尚有餘。」
translation: The masses then all ate this food and were able to fill it up, but there was still something left.

source_sentence: 時諸聲聞及諸菩薩并人天等一切眾會，食此食已其身安樂，譬如一切安樂莊嚴世界菩薩一切安樂之所住持，
translation: “Then the disciples and enlightening beings, as well as all the assemblies of humans and celestial beings, who had eaten this food, felt at ease in their bodies.

source_sentence: 身諸毛孔皆出妙香；
translation: The hair pores of his body all emitted a wonderful fragrance.

source_sentence: 譬如一切妙香世界眾妙香樹常出無量種種妙香。
translation: It's like the many wonderful fragrant trees in all the wonderful fragrant worlds that always produce measureless and various kinds of wonderful fragrance.

source_sentence: 時無垢稱問彼上方諸來菩薩：「汝等知不？
translation: The Licchavi Vimalakīrti then asked the bodhisattvas above, Do you know?

source_sentence: 彼土如來於其世界為諸菩薩云何說法？」
translation: How did the Tathāgata of that land teach the Dharma to the bodhisattvas in that world?

source_sentence: 彼諸菩薩咸共答言：「我土如來不為菩薩文詞說法，但以妙香令諸菩薩皆悉調伏。」
translation: The bodhisattvas all replied, The Tathāgata of my land doesn't teach the Dharma for the bodhisattvas in words but uses a wonderful fragrance to cause them to be completely subdued.

source_sentence: 「彼諸菩薩各各安坐妙香樹下，諸妙香樹各各流出種種香氣，彼諸菩薩聞斯妙香便獲一切德莊嚴定，
translation: Each of those bodhisattvas was seated under a tree of exquisite fragrance, and each of those exquisite fragrant trees produced its own distinctive fragrance. On hearing that exquisite fragrance, those bodhisattvas attained the concentration adorned with all virtues.

source_sentence: 獲此定已即具一切菩薩功德。」
translation: After attaining this concentration, he'll then be endowed with all the bodhisattva virtues.

source_sentence: 時彼上方諸來菩薩問無垢稱：「此土如來釋迦牟尼為諸有情云何說法？」
translation: The bodhisattvas above them then asked the Licchavi Vimalakīrti, How does the Tathāgata Śākyamuni of this land explain the teaching for sentient beings?

source_sentence: 無垢稱曰：「此土有情一切剛強極難調化，如來還以種種能伏剛強語言而調化之。
translation: The Licchavi Vimalakīrti said, All the sentient beings in this land are rigid and extremely difficult to tame, but the Tathāgata tames them with various kinds of words that can subdue their rigidity.

source_sentence: 云何名為種種能伏剛強語言？
translation: What's called various kinds of words that can subdue rigidity?

source_sentence: 謂為宣說此是地獄趣、此是傍生趣、此是餓鬼趣，此是無暇生、此是諸根缺，
translation: This is to proclaim that this is the destiny of hell, this is the destiny of animals, this is the destiny of hungry ghosts, this is the absence of leisurely birth, and this is a lack of faculties.

source_sentence: 此是身惡行、是身惡行果，此是語惡行、是語惡行果，此是意惡行、是意惡行果，
translation: These are the results of bad bodily actions and bad bodily actions. These are the results of bad speech and bad speech.

source_sentence: 此是斷生命、是斷生命果，此是不與取、是不與取果，此是欲邪行、是欲邪行果，
translation: This is the fruit of cutting off life and this is the fruit of cutting off life. This is taking what is not given and grasping what is not given.

source_sentence: 此是虛誑語、是虛誑語果，此是離間語、是離間語果，此是麁惡語、是麁惡語果，

source_sentence: 「或有佛土為諸有情種種文詞宣說幻夢、光影、水月、響聲、陽焰、鏡像、浮雲、健達縛城、帝網等喻而作佛事；
translation: “Some buddha-lands accomplish buddha-work by explaining to sentient beings magical illusions, lights, shadows, water moons, sounds, mirages, mirror images, floating clouds, the cities of Gandhāra and Indra’s Net, etc.

source_sentence: 或有佛土以其音聲、語言、文字宣說種種諸法性相而作佛事；
translation: “Some buddha-lands do buddha-work by means of their voices, words, and syllables expounding the various essential characteristics of reality.

source_sentence: 或有佛土清淨寂寞，無言、無說，無訶、無讚，無所推求、無有戲論，
translation: “Some buddha-lands are pure and lonely, without words or explanations, without criticism or praise, without presupposition or elaboration.

source_sentence: 無表、無示，所化有情因斯寂寞自然證入諸法性相而作佛事。
translation: Because they are unexpressed and unmanifest, the sentient beings they transform become lonely and naturally realize the nature and characteristics of dharmas and perform buddha-works.

source_sentence: 「如是當知：十方世界諸佛國土其數無邊，所作佛事亦無數量。
translation: “Thus, you should know that the number of buddha lands in the worlds of the ten directions is limitless, and the Buddha’s works are also limitless.

source_sentence: 以要言之，諸佛所有威儀、進止、受用、施為，皆令所化有情調伏，是故一切皆名佛事。
translation: To sum up, all the buddhas' mannerisms, movements, enjoyments, and acts of generosity cause the sentient beings they teach to be disciplined; therefore, all are called buddha-works.

source_sentence: 「又，諸世間所有四魔、八萬四千諸煩惱門，有情之類為其所惱，一切如來即以此法為諸眾生而作佛事。
translation: Furthermore, all the four Māras and 84,000 afflictive tendencies in the world are harmed by sentient beings, and all the Tathāgatas do buddha-work for sentient beings because of this teaching.

source_sentence: 「汝今當知：如是法門名為悟入一切佛法。
translation: “Now, you should know that such a teaching is called awakening to all the buddha-teachings.

source_sentence: 若諸菩薩入此法門，雖見一切成就無量廣大功德嚴淨佛土不生喜貪、雖見一切無諸功德雜穢佛土不生憂恚，
translation: “Furthermore, if enlightening beings who enter this teaching see all the buddha-lands adorned with immeasurable great virtue and accomplished in all respects, they will not be filled with joy or craving. And if they see all the buddha-lands that are without virtues but mixed with defilement, they will not be filled with sorrow.

source_sentence: 於諸佛所發生上品信樂恭敬，歎未曾有。
translation: They develop high-minded faith in and respect for the buddhas and praise it as unprecedented.

source_sentence: 諸佛、世尊一切功德平等圓滿——得一切法究竟真實平等性故——為欲成熟差別有情示現種種差別佛土。
translation: The buddhas and world-honored ones are equally complete in all merits - because they attain the ultimate true equality of all dharmas - and they show various different buddha-lands for the sake of ripening sentient beings with distinctions.

source_sentence: 「汝今當知：如諸佛土雖所依地勝劣不同，而上虛空都無差別。
translation: “Now you should know that just as the buddha-lands, even though the superiority and inferiority of the grounds on which they rest are different, there is no distinction in space above them.

source_sentence: 如是當知：諸佛、世尊為欲成熟諸有情故，雖現種種色身不同而無障礙，
translation: Thus it should be known that the buddhas and world-honored ones, in order to develop sentient beings, manifest various form bodies differently but without obstruction,

source_sentence: 福德智慧究竟圓滿都無差別。
translation: There's no distinction between the ultimate perfection of merit and wisdom.

source_sentence: 「汝今當知：一切如來悉皆平等——所謂最上周圓無極形色威光、諸相隨好、族姓尊貴、清淨尸羅定慧解脫解脫知見、諸力無畏不共佛法、大慈大悲大喜大捨利益安樂、威儀所行正行壽量、說法度脫成熟有情、清淨佛土，
translation: “Now you should know that all tathāgatas are completely equal-the so-called supremely perfect, limitless form and form, authoritative radiance, the secondary signs, the noble castes, the pure morality, wisdom, liberation, liberation, knowledge and vision, the powers, fearlessness, unique qualities of buddhahood, great kindness, great com

source_sentence: 悉皆平等。
translation: They are all equal.

source_sentence: 以諸如來一切佛法悉皆平等，最上周圓究竟無盡，是故皆同名正等覺、名為如來、名為佛陀。
translation: Because all the Tathāgatas' buddha-dharmas are all equal, most perfect and ultimately inexhaustible, they are all called correctly enlightened, called tathāgatas, and called buddhas together.

source_sentence: 「汝今當知：設令我欲分別廣說此三句義，汝經劫住無間聽受，窮其壽量亦不能盡。
translation: “Now you should know that if I were to explain these three meanings of these three phrases in detail, your life span would be uninterrupted for an eon and you wouldn’t be able to hear them until the end of their lifespan.

source_sentence: 假使三千大千世界有情之類，皆如阿難得念總持多聞第一，咸經劫住無間聽受，
translation: Suppose there were sentient beings in the great manifold cosmos of 3,000 worlds, all like Ānanda, who had no difficulty remembering and retaining the pre-eminently learned; they would all live for an eon without interruption to hear and receive.

source_sentence: 窮其壽量亦不能盡。
translation: It doesn't reach the limit of its life span and can't be exhausted.

source_sentence: 此正等覺、如來、佛陀三句妙義，無能究竟宣揚決擇，唯除諸佛。
translation: These three marvelous meanings of righteous perfect enlightenment, the Tathāgata, and the Buddha have no ability to ultimately proclaim their discernment, except for the buddhas.

source_sentence: 如是當知：諸佛菩提功德無量，無滯妙辯不可思議。」
translation: Thus, you should know that the merit of the buddhas' enlightenment is immeasurable, and their unhindered marvelous eloquence is inconceivable.

source_sentence: 說是語已，時阿難陀白言：「世尊！
translation: After he spoke these words, Ānanda then said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我從今去不敢自稱得念總持多聞第一。」
translation: From now on, I won't dare to claim to be the best-versed master of mindfulness and recollection.

source_sentence: 佛便告曰：「汝今不應心生退屈。
translation: The Buddha then told them, Now, you shouldn't retrogress in your mind.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我自昔來但說汝於聲聞眾中得念總持多聞第一，非於菩薩。
translation: Since the distant past, I've only said that you were the first among śrāvakas to attain mindfulness of the general maintenance of well-versedness, not the bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 汝今且止，其有智者不應測量諸菩薩事。
translation: Now, you must stop. Those who are wise shouldn't survey the bodhisattva's affairs.

source_sentence: 汝今當知：一切大海源底深淺猶可測量，菩薩智慧念定總持辯才大海無能測者。
translation: You should now know that all the depths and depths of the ocean's source can still be measured, but there's no one who can fathom the great ocean of enlightening beings' wisdom, mindfulness, concentration, general maintenance, and eloquence.

source_sentence: 汝等聲聞置諸菩薩所行境界不應思惟；
translation: “O śrāvakas! You should place the sphere of enlightening beings’ practice without thinking about it.

source_sentence: 於一食頃是無垢稱示現變化所作神通，一切聲聞及諸獨覺百千大劫示現變化神力所作亦不能及。」
translation: In a moment's time, this is the miraculous power that the unsullied name shows and transforms, which all śrāvakas and solitary realizers can't do with the miraculous power of showing and transforming for a hundred thousand great eons.

source_sentence: 時彼上方諸來菩薩皆起禮拜釋迦牟尼，合掌恭敬白言：「世尊！
translation: The bodhisattvas above them then all stood up to venerate Śākyamuni, joined their palms in respect, and said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等初來見此佛土種種雜穢生下劣想，今皆悔愧捨離是心。
translation: When we first came here, we saw the various defilements of this Buddha land and gave rise to inferior thoughts, but now we're all repenting and feeling ashamed and abandoning that mind.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸佛境界方便善巧不可思議，為欲成熟諸有情故，如如有情所樂差別，
translation: The buddhas’ spheres of skill in means are inconceivable, because they want to develop sentient beings. Just as there is a difference between the inclinations of sentient beings and those of others:

source_sentence: 如是如是示現佛土。
translation: Thus and so forth, they show the Buddha's land.

source_sentence: 唯然，世尊！
translation: Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 願賜少法，當還一切妙香世界，由此法故常念如來。」
translation: May I bestow a little teaching that will return to all the wonderful fragrant worlds, and because of this teaching, I'll always think of the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 說是語已，世尊告彼諸來菩薩言：「善男子！
translation: After speaking these words, the Bhagavān addressed those coming bodhisattvas, Good sons!

source_sentence: 有諸菩薩解脫法門名有盡無盡，汝今敬受當勤修學。
translation: There are bodhisattvas whose liberation dharmas are called endless and inexhaustible, so now you should respectfully accept them and diligently cultivate them.

source_sentence: 云何名為有盡無盡？
translation: What's called having an end and no end?

source_sentence: 言有盡者，即是有為，有生滅法；
translation: The expression having destruction refers to conditioned dharmas that are accompanied by arising and ceasing.

source_sentence: 言無盡者，即是無為，無生滅法。
translation: The expression inexhaustible refers to the unconditioned, which has no arising or ceasing dharmas.

source_sentence: 「菩薩不應盡其有為，亦復不應住於無為。
translation: A bodhisattva shouldn't end what's conditioned, and he shouldn't abide in what's unconditioned.

source_sentence: 云何菩薩不盡有為？
translation: How does a bodhisattva not terminate conditioned things?

source_sentence: 謂諸菩薩不棄大慈、不捨大悲，曾所生起增上意樂，一切智心繫念寶重而不暫忘，
translation: It means that bodhisattvas don’t abandon great kindness and compassion, give rise to superior aspirations that have been produced in the past, mentally focus on the treasures of omniscience without forgetting them for a moment.

source_sentence: 成熟有情常無厭倦，於四攝事恒不棄捨，護持正法不惜身命，求習諸善終無厭足。
translation: They develop sentient beings without weariness and never give up the four methods of salvation. They preserve the true-dharma tirelessly, not begrudging their bodies and lives, seeking to cultivate all good deeds with no weariness at all.

source_sentence: 常樂安立迴向善巧，詢求正法曾無懈倦，敷演法教不作師倦。
translation: He always delights in establishing and dedicating himself to skillful means, never lazy in seeking the right teaching, and he spreads out the teaching of the Dharma without becoming tired of being a teacher.

source_sentence: 常欣瞻仰供事諸佛，故受生死而無怖畏、雖遇興衰而無欣慼，於諸未學終不輕陵、於已學者敬愛如佛，
translation: They always delight in seeing and honoring buddhas, so they experience births and deaths without fear or rejoicing even when they are encountered. They do not despise those who have never studied the Dharma but venerate and love those who have already studied it as buddhas.

source_sentence: 於煩惱雜能如理思、於遠離樂能不耽染，於己樂事曾無味著、於他樂事深心隨喜，
translation: Being able to think correctly about the mixture of afflictions and being able not to indulge in seclusion from pleasure, they never have taste or attachment for their own pleasures and profoundly rejoice deeply at the pleasures of others.

source_sentence: 於所修習靜慮解脫等持等至如地獄想而不味著、於所遊歷界趣生死如宮苑想而不厭離，
translation: They don’t cling to the perception of meditative absorption, liberation from meditation, and so forth as being like hell; they don’t become disillusioned with the perception of sentient beings wandering in the realms of birth and death as palaces and gardens.

source_sentence: 於乞求者生善友想捨諸所有皆無顧悋，於一切智起迴向想，於諸毀禁起救護想，
translation: He thinks of beggars as good friends and abandons all possessions without concern, conceives the thought of dedication of all knowledge, and conceives the thought of protecting those who break the precepts.

source_sentence: 於波羅蜜多如父母想速令圓滿，於菩提分法如翼從想不令究竟，於諸善法常勤修習、於諸佛土恒樂莊嚴、於他佛土深心欣讚、於自佛土能速成就。
translation: They quickly complete the perception of the perfections as parents, don't let the perception of the factors of enlightenment as wings to be perfected, always diligently cultivate good qualities, always delight in the adornments of buddha-lands, deeply rejoice in the profound praise of other buddha-lands, and are able to quickly accomplish them in their own

source_sentence: 「為諸相好圓滿莊嚴，修行清淨無礙大施；
translation: “Great enlightening beings practice pure, unobstructed great giving to adorn themselves with all their marks and embellishments.

source_sentence: 為身語心嚴飾清淨，遠離一切犯戒惡法；
translation: Their bodies, speech, and minds are beautifully adorned and pure, far removed from all bad ways of violating the precepts.

source_sentence: 為令身心堅固堪忍，遠離一切忿恨煩惱；
translation: “Great enlightening beings’ bodies and minds are free from all anger, hatred, and afflictions in order to make their bodies and minds firm and endure.

source_sentence: 為令所修速得究竟，經劫無數生死流轉；
translation: In order to enable those who practice it to quickly attain its ultimate goal, they pass countless eons in the transmigration of birth and death.

source_sentence: 為令自心勇猛堅住，聽佛無量功德不倦；
translation: In order to cause their own minds to be courageous and firm, they hear the Buddha’s immeasurable virtues without weariness.

source_sentence: 為欲永害煩惱怨敵，方便修治般若刀杖；
translation: In order to permanently harm the enemies of afflictions, they skillfully cultivate the sword and cane of wisdom.

source_sentence: 為欲荷諸有情重擔，於蘊界處求遍了知；
translation: In order to bear the heavy burdens of sentient beings, they seek omniscience in all aggregates and realms.

source_sentence: 為欲摧伏一切魔軍，熾然精進曾無懈怠；
translation: In order to subdue all the armies of demons they undertake, never lazily exerting themselves with fervor.

source_sentence: 為欲護持無上正法，離慢，勤求善巧化智；
translation: In order to preserve the supreme true teaching, free from conceit and pride, they diligently seek knowledge of skillful means of liberation.

source_sentence: 為諸世間愛重受化，常樂習行，少欲知足。
translation: Because the world loves to receive instruction, always enjoys accumulation and practice, has few desires and is satisfied.

source_sentence: 「於諸世法恒無雜染，而能隨順一切世間；
translation: “Great enlightening beings are always unstained by worldly phenomena, yet able to adapt to all worlds.

source_sentence: 於諸威儀恒無毀壞，而能示現一切所作。
translation: They are always unhurt in all manner of deportment, yet they can show what they do.

source_sentence: 「發生種種神通妙慧，利益安樂一切有情；
translation: They develop various subtle knowledges of mystic powers, benefiting and comforting all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 受持一切所聞正法，為起妙智正念總持；
translation: They receive and uphold all the true teachings they hear, to produce the comprehensive maintenance of right mindfulness with subtle knowledge.

source_sentence: 發生諸根勝劣妙智，為斷一切有情疑惑；
translation: They develop superior and inferior knowledge of all faculties in order to dispel the doubts of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 證得種種無礙辯才，敷演正法常無擁滯；
translation: They attain various unhindered powers of elucidation, always expounding the truth without obstruction.

source_sentence: 為受人天殊勝喜樂，勤修清淨十善業道；
translation: In order to receive the great joy and happiness of humans and gods, they diligently cultivate the pure ten wholesome paths of action.

source_sentence: 為正開發梵天道路，勤進修行四無量智；
translation: In order to develop the path of enlightenment, they diligently practiced the four immeasurable knowledges.

source_sentence: 為得諸佛上妙音聲，勸請說法，隨喜讚善；
translation: In order to attain the supreme voice of the Buddhas, they invited them to expound the Teaching and praised their goodness with joy.

source_sentence: 為得諸佛上妙威儀，常修殊勝寂靜三業；
translation: In order to attain the supremely sublime comportment of buddhas, they always cultivate the three practices of transcendent quiescence.

source_sentence: 為令所修念念增勝，於一切法心無染滯；
translation: I elucidate the means of attaining enlightenment, so as to increase the power of mindfulness cultivated. My mind is not attached to any things.

source_sentence: 為善調御諸菩薩僧，常以大乘勸眾生學；
translation: In order to skillfully tame the enlightening beings, they always urge sentient beings to learn by means of the Great Vehicle.

source_sentence: 為不失壞所有功德，於一切時常無放逸；
translation: In order to preserve all the virtues of enlightening beings, they do not lose or break them. They always have no laxity at all times.

source_sentence: 為諸善根展轉增進，常樂修治種種大願；
translation: In order to develop and perfect the roots of goodness, they always delight in cultivating various great vows.

source_sentence: 為欲莊嚴一切佛土，常勤修習廣大善根；
translation: Desiring to adorn all buddha-lands, they always diligently cultivate vast roots of goodness.

source_sentence: 為令所修究竟無盡，常修迴向善巧方便。
translation: In order to cause what they cultivate to be ultimately inexhaustible, they always cultivate skillful means of dedication.

source_sentence: 「諸善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 修行此法是名菩薩不盡有為。
translation: To cultivate this teaching is called a bodhisattva who doesn't end existence.

source_sentence: 「云何菩薩不住無為？
translation: How does a bodhisattva not abide in nonexistence?

source_sentence: 謂諸菩薩雖行於空，而於其空不樂作證；
translation: It means that even though enlightening beings practice emptiness, they do not delight in realizing emptiness.

source_sentence: 雖行無相，而於無相不樂作證；
translation: Though they act without marks, yet they do not delight in the realization of signlessness.

source_sentence: 雖行無願，而於無願不樂作證；
translation: Though they practice wishlessness, yet they do not delight in the realization of wishlessness.

source_sentence: 雖行無作，而於無作不樂作證；
translation: Though they practice what is unmanifest, yet do not delight in realization of what is unmanifest.

source_sentence: 雖觀諸行皆悉無常，而於善根心無厭足；
translation: Though they observe all conditioned phenomena to be impermanent, yet they are not satisfied with the roots of goodness.

source_sentence: 雖觀世間一切皆苦，而於生死故意受生；
translation: Though they observe that all things in the world are painful, yet they deliberately undergo birth in birth and death.

source_sentence: 雖樂觀察內無有我，而不畢竟厭捨自身；
translation: Though they delight in observing that there is no self within, yet they do not ultimately become disillusioned with themselves.

source_sentence: 雖樂觀察外無有情，而常化導心無厭倦；
translation: Though they delight in observing that there are no sentient beings outside, yet they always teach and guide their minds without weariness.

source_sentence: 雖觀涅槃畢竟寂靜，而不畢竟墮於寂滅；
translation: Though they contemplate the ultimate quiescence of nirvana, yet they do not ultimately fall into it.

source_sentence: 雖觀遠離究竟安樂，而不究竟厭患身心；
translation: Though they observe detachment from ultimate bliss, yet they do not ultimately become disillusioned with body and mind.

source_sentence: 雖樂觀察無阿賴耶，而不棄捨清白法藏；
translation: Though they delight in observing the absence of store consciousness, yet they do not abandon the pure treasury of truth.

source_sentence: 雖觀諸法畢竟無生，而常荷負利眾生事；
translation: Though they observe all things are ultimately birthless, yet they always bear the burden of serving sentient beings.

source_sentence: 雖觀無漏，而於生死流轉不絕；
translation: Though they contemplate the uncontaminated, yet their transmigration in birth and death never ends.

source_sentence: 雖觀無行，而行成熟諸有情事；
translation: Though they contemplate practice without practice, yet practice develops the affairs of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 雖觀無我，而於有情不捨大悲；
translation: Though they contemplate selflessness, yet they do not give up great compassion for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 雖觀無生，而於二乘不墮正位；
translation: Though they contemplate nonorigination, yet they do not fall into the realm of the two vehicles.

source_sentence: 雖觀諸法畢竟空寂，而不空寂所修福德；
translation: Though they observe all things are ultimately void and quiescent, they do not cultivate the virtues of emptiness and quiescence.

source_sentence: 雖觀諸法畢竟遠離，而不遠離所修智慧；
translation: Though they contemplate all things as ultimately separate, yet they are not separate from the wisdom they cultivate.

source_sentence: 雖觀諸法畢竟無實，而常安住圓滿思惟；
translation: Though they observe all things ultimately have no substance, yet they always abide in perfect contemplation.

source_sentence: 雖觀諸法畢竟無主，而常精勤求自然智；
translation: Though they observe all things ultimately have no owner, yet they always diligently strive to find spontaneous knowledge.

source_sentence: 雖觀諸法永無幖幟，而於了義安立佛種。
translation: Although he observes that all dharmas are always without labels, he establishes the buddha-seed in understanding their meaning.

source_sentence: 「諸善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 修行此法是名菩薩不住無為。
translation: To cultivate this teaching is called a bodhisattva who doesn't abide in nonexistence.

source_sentence: 「又，善男子！
translation: Again, good man!

source_sentence: 以諸菩薩常勤修集福資糧故不住無為，常勤修集智資糧故不盡有為；
translation: Because enlightening beings always diligently cultivate accumulations of virtue, they do not abide in the unconditioned; because they always diligently cultivate accumulations of knowledge, they do not exhaust the conditioned.

source_sentence: 成就大慈無缺減故不住無為，成就大悲無缺減故不盡有為；
translation: Because of the accomplishment of great compassion without deficiency, they do not abide in unconditioned things; because of the accomplishment of great compassion without deficiency, they do not destroy conditioned things.

source_sentence: 利益安樂諸有情故不住無為，究竟圓滿諸佛法故不盡有為；
translation: They do not abide in unconditioned things for the benefit and welfare of sentient beings. Because they ultimately fulfill the buddha-teachings, they do not destroy conditioned things.

source_sentence: 成滿一切相好莊嚴佛色身故不住無為，證得一切力無畏等佛智身故不盡有為；
translation: They do not abide in the unconditioned because they perfect all marks and embellishments of buddha-form bodies. Because they realize the body of omniscience equal to all powers and fearlessnesses, they do not destroy conditioned things.

source_sentence: 方便善巧化眾生故不住無為，微妙智慧善觀察故不盡有為；
translation: They do not abide in the unconditioned because they skillfully liberate sentient beings through means. Because of subtle wisdom and good observation, they do not destroy the conditioned.

source_sentence: 修治佛土究竟滿故不住無為，佛身安住常無盡故不盡有為；
translation: Because they cultivate the perfect fulfillment of buddha-lands, they do not abide in unconditioned things. Because the body of Buddha abides peacefully and eternally, it does not destroy conditioned things.

source_sentence: 常作饒益眾生事故不住無為，領受法義無休廢故不盡有為；
translation: They always do things for the benefit of sentient beings; they do not abide in unconditioned things. Because they receive the meaning of truth without ceasing, they do not destroy conditioned things.

source_sentence: 積集善根常無盡故不住無為，善根力持不斷壞故不盡有為；
translation: Because the accumulation of roots of merit is always inexhaustible, one does not abide in unconditioned things. Because the supporting power of roots of merit sustains and does not disintegrate, conditioned things are not exhausted.

source_sentence: 為欲成滿本所願故不住無為，於永寂滅不希求故不盡有為；
translation: They do not abide in unconditioned things because they want to fulfill their original vow. Because they do not seek eternal extinction, they do not destroy conditioned things.

source_sentence: 圓滿意樂善清淨故不住無為，增上意樂善清淨故不盡有為；
translation: Because perfect mental command is good and pure, they do not abide in the unconditioned; because superior mental command is good and pure, they do not destroy the conditioned.

source_sentence: 恒常遊戲五神通故不住無為，佛智六通善圓滿故不盡有為；
translation: They do not abide in unconditioned things because they always play with the five supernatural powers. Because Buddha knowledge and the six supernormal knowledges are well fulfilled, they do not destroy conditioned things.

source_sentence: 波羅蜜多資糧滿故不住無為，本所思惟未圓滿故不盡有為；
translation: Because the provisions of the perfections are fulfilled, they do not abide in unconditioned things. Because what they originally thought is not fulfilled yet, they do not destroy conditioned things.

source_sentence: 集法財寶常無厭故不住無為，不樂希求少分法故不盡有為；
translation: They do not abide in the unconditioned because they always accumulate the treasures of the wealth of the doctrine without weariness. Because they do not delight in seeking even a small part of the doctrine, they do not destroy the conditioned.

source_sentence: 堅牢誓願常無退故不住無為，能令誓願究竟滿故不盡有為；
translation: Because their firm vow never recedes, they do not abide in the unconditioned; because they are able to cause their vows to be fulfilled, they do not exhaust the conditioned.

source_sentence: 積集一切妙法藥故不住無為，隨其所應授法藥故不盡有為；
translation: Because they accumulate all medicines of the fine dharma, they do not abide in unconditioned things. Because they preach the medicine of the dharma as appropriate to them, they do not destroy conditioned things.

source_sentence: 遍知眾生煩惱病故不住無為，息除眾生煩惱病故不盡有為。
translation: He pervasively knows that sentient beings don't abide in the unconditioned because of their afflictions and illnesses, and he doesn't end the conditioned because he extinguishes the afflictions and illnesses of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「諸善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 菩薩如是不盡有為、不住無為，是名安住有盡無盡解脫法門，汝等皆當精勤修學。」
translation: Thus, bodhisattvas who don't end existence and don't abide in nonexistence are called abiding in the Dharma aspect of liberation that has an end and no end, and you should all diligently cultivate it.

source_sentence: 爾時，一切妙香世界最上香臺如來佛土諸來菩薩聞說如是有盡無盡解脫門已，
translation: Then the enlightening beings and buddha-lands of all buddha-fields, having heard this inconceivable liberation, conceived their spirits of unexcelled, inexhaustible knowledge.

source_sentence: 法教開發勸勵其心，皆大歡喜，身心踊躍，以無量種上妙香花、諸莊嚴具供養世尊及諸菩薩并此所說有盡無盡解脫法門。
translation: The teaching of the Dharma encouraged their minds, and they all rejoiced greatly, jumped for joy in body and mind, offered measureless kinds of exquisitely fragrant flowers, adornments, and offerings to the Bhagavān, the bodhisattvas, and this teaching of the Dharma of endless and inexhaustible liberation.

source_sentence: 復以種種上妙香花散遍三千大千世界，香花覆地深沒於膝。
translation: Again, he spreads various kinds of exquisitely fragrant flowers over 3,000 great one-thousand worlds, covering the ground and kneeling deeply.

source_sentence: 時諸菩薩恭敬頂禮世尊雙足，右繞三匝，稱揚讚頌釋迦牟尼及諸菩薩并所說法，
translation: The enlightening beings bowed their heads at the feet of the World-honored One and circumambulated him three times to his right.

source_sentence: 於此佛土欻然不現，經須臾間便住彼國。
translation: In this buddha land, he suddenly disappeared and stayed in that country for a short time.

translation: Shuo wuglishheng jing, vol. 5
